commit message: Initial commit to GitHub.  Version 1.0
Version 1.1.  Reworked GUI into simpler form.  Formatted code.
Version 1.2.  Downgraded API requirement from Android 1.6 to Android 1.5.  Minor text changes.
Version 2.0.  New spinning coin animaion.  Shake sensitivity tweaks.  Code refactoring and cleanup.
Added coin sound.  Fixed copyright comment blocks.
Version 2.1.1.  Added preference toggle for animation and sound.
QR code image linking to app in Android Market.

Cleaned up animation state machine.  Turns out this was never working right, and thus the animation always started with heads (regardless of the current result).  On the bright side, the annimation was too fast to actually notice.  Also adjusted the number of rotations in each animation and made vibrate a tunable option.
Forgot the MDPI animations in the previous commit.
Added U.S. Mint attribution to README file.
Fixed ANR hangs by using SoundPool instead of MediaPlayer.
Added embedded menu icons extracted from SDK 8 as per best practices of not referencing the built-ins directly.  Added the 1-up easter egg. :)
Cleaned up the sound logic a bit.

Initial commit of version 3.0.  This adds basic support for loading
coins from an external package (namely com.banasiak.coinflipext).  It's
not completely working yet - it still always displays the default coin.
Much more testing is also required.

External package work is mostly complete.  Still needs some edge-case
testing.

Version 3.0.1.  Code for market release.  Load from external package
complete.

Version 3.1. Added a preference (from AOSP) to tweak the sensitivity of
the ShakeListener or to disable it completely.
Fixed strings.

Made sensitivity slider snap to multiples of 20.  (Results in a
force multiplier of: Off, 20, 40, 60, 80, 100.)
Version 3.1.2 commit of slider preference snap points.

Settings activity wasn't using the new key for the shake sensitivity
preference.

Fixed an edge case where it was theoretically possible to exceed 100
flips without playing the 1-up sound if tapping fast enough.  (Also, the
counter was off by one because the sound would play before incrementing
the flip count.)  I suppose these unforeseen issues are a valid argument
against having easter eggs sneak their way into code. :)
Version 3.1.4 - Miscellaneous edge-case bug fixes.
Test commit.  Please ignore.
Version 3.2 - Made display of HEADS/TAILS text configurable.

Shortened TEXT preference summary string to fit on one line on MDPI
devices.

1. Trying out Android i18n by adding a Spanish string translation.  I
used Google Translate, so I apologize for it most likely being wrong.

2. Externalized the strings from the Self Test activity.

3. Added some additional debugging to the Settings class.
Changed version to 3.2.1 for release to Android Market.

Initial commit of SCF4 to master branch.  Added dynamic
AnimationDrawable creation based on full sized Drawables.
Updated README with SCF4 notice.

Added dynamic animation frame rendering.  So, the entire animation is
based off a single image now, instead of pre-rendering the frames like
in SCF3.  This will make the package size smaller, but requires more
CPU.

Disabled animation frame rendering if animations are disabled.  This
is 4.0 RC1.  I will release it to Android Market after
I test it and the new add-on package for a couple weeks.

SCF 4.0 release.  Implemented settings schema versioning, since SCF4 can
potentially use the same settings keys from a previous version with
values that no longer exist.  This would cause a force close.  So, now
when the app detects a schema version different from what is defined,
all settings get reset.

Pre-rendered all animations via onResume() and stored in a hash map
instead of rendering animations each time the coin is flipped.  This
might cause a slight delay when first starting the app, or after exiting
the preference screen, but should prevent out-of-memory errors when
rapidly flipping the coin.

Added real-time Self Test GUI updating because my friend Alex showed me
how. Honestly probably the least simple part of 'Simple Coin Flip'. :)
Version 4.1 for Android Market.

Fixed an edge-case reported by a user where a null value was returned
from the CoinAnimationsMap.  I think this has something to do with the
state being confused immediately following an upgrade to version 4.1 and
the hashmaps weren't being initialized.  Regardless, the code protects
against this now by resetting the coin.
Updated README for GitHub.

Version 4.1.1 - Fixed crash caused by attempting to get an animation
from the map, but the map is empty because animations are disabled.
Updated app description in README.
Added a 'random coin' option if the add-on pack is installed.

1. Switched menu icons to Gingerbread style.  2. Enabled hardware
acceleration for ICS in the manifest.  3. Updated copyright for 2012.
Updated project properties with ICS compiler target.

Rewrote the shake listener because I always hated the previous
implementation.  Shaking (for the purpose of this app, at least) is now
detected more smoothly.
Version 4.2 for Android Market.  Cleaned up some Lint warnings.

Version 4.2.1 - Fixed runaway flipping when shaking was supposedly
disabled. Updated target API to Gingerbread (since I don't have the
HC/ICS menu system implemented yet).
Miscellaneous code cleanup and comments.
Added URL back into README.

Updated the library loading code to load multiple external resource files, not just the one hardcoded file.

Also made the animation duration a variable : )

Merge pull request #1 from xbakesx/master

Dynamic Coin Package Load
Initial commit of SCF 5.0.
Updated README for GitHub with new branch information.
Code cleanup after merge.

Added additional error-handling logic in case an add-in package is
removed or otherwise disappears (SD card removed?).
Version 5.0 for Android Market.
Updated README for SCF 5.0 release.

After extensive usability testing at lunch yesterday, it seems like all
of the marketing and graphics people did not realize the coin had to be
tapped to initiate the flip.  They felt compelled to tap anywhere on the
screen.  So, now you can.
Version 5.0.1 for Android Market.

Attempt to get rid of the 'bitmap size exceeds VM budget' problem that
seems to occur on pre-Froyo devices.  This might not be the right thing
to do here, but this fixes it on the only device I can reproduce it on
(Motorola Cliq w/ Cupcake).

Disabling the garbage collection implemented in the last commit.  It
sorta fixes the problem on old devices, but the lag on new, high-end
devices annoys me.  This probably wasn't the right way to fix the
problem anyways.
Miscellaneous cleanup and README update.

Only resize the images once and reuse these when generating the
animation, instead of resizing the images each time an animation is
built.  This will hopefully fix some of the heap blowouts.
Added statistics tracking feature per user request.

Version 5.2.1

1. Progrmatically pull the version number from the manifest for the about dialog (because I always forget to update that string).
2.  Localized the statistics reset button text.
3. Miscellaneous code formatting fixes.
Added button to About dialog encouraging users to rate this app on the Google Play store.
Adjusted framework to support Holo theme and action bar on Honeycomb+ (v11+) devices.
Reverting version number prior to branch.
Initial commit of SCF 6.0.  The plan for this version is to add dynamic scaling to support multiple device screen sizes.  This will deprecate the SCFHD branch/app.
Version 5.3 for Android Market.
Updated target API to JellyBean 4.2.  Tweaked menu ordering and icons.
New (clearer) coin sounds.
Merge branch 'SCF5' into 'master'

Version 5.3.2 for Google Play.  Also changed self-test fonts from DP to
SP per best practices.
Merge branch 'SCF5' into 'master'
Reformatted code according to Android code style guidelines (http://source.android.com/source/code-style.html).
Added configuration option for the number of iterations used by the Self Test (renamed to Diagnostics).  Bumped to version 5.4 for the Play Store.
Version 5.4.1.  Worked around issue with Google Play search where not all packages were being returned when clicking 'Get More Coins' in Settings.
Oops.  Forgot to previously add ic_menu_diagnostics.png to the repository.  Here they are. :)

Finally elminiated that pesky bug where the app would run in the background even after the app was paused.  Pausing the app would disable the shake listener, but the animation thread wasn't finished running, then the callback would re-enable the shake listener even though the app dropped to the background.  Solved this by a stricter management of the onClick/shake listeners during pause/resume and removing shake listener callbacks onPause.

Also made a separate settings.xml file for v14+ devices which uses the fancy SwitchPreference instead of CheckBoxPreference.

Bumped version to v5.5 for the Play Store.
Don't need that variable dangling around...
Improved Spanish (Latin America) translations?  Shrug.  They cost $7.45 from the Google Play translation service.
Version 5.5.1 for the Google Play store.

Changed the main layout from TableLayout to LinearLayout (with a nested horizontal LinearLayout for stats).  This keeps the coin ImageView from stretching when the translated instructions text was wider than the image.
Version 5.5.2 for the Google Play store.
French translation

Merge pull request #4 from RyDroid/master

French translation by RyDroid.
Migrated source code to Gradle.
Manually refactored directory structure to support a Mobile (phone/tablet) project, Android Wear project and a common library to share between them.
Moved code common to mobile/wear apps to library project.
Renamed activity classes where appropriate.  Updated copyright statements.
Experimental support for Android Wear
Updated README
Updated README
Initial support for add-on coins on the wearable app.  The code is really rough and needs to be cleaned up and commented.
Version 6.1 for Google Play.
Enabled default ProGuard optimizations and shrunk the release APK 36%.

Version 6.2.1 for Google Play.
1. Centered wearable layout.
2. Put wearable animation generation and data transfer on a background thread to speed up initial app load.

Version 6.3 for Google Play.
1. Material theme for Lollipop devices.
2. Detect when new coin packages are installed and restart the app automatically to load them.
Forgot to material theme the dialog activities. (Technically forgot to Holo theme them back in the day, too.  Oops.)
Updated about page.
Version 6.3.1 for Google Play.  Added fallback drawables to the wear app in case it can't receive the appropriate images from the mobile device.
Updated README
Updated target SDK versions.
Inititial checkin of german localization (de)...
Inititial checkin of german localization (de)...

Merge pull request #5 from MichaelRiepen/master

German localization
Version 6.3.2 for Google Play.
Updated README.
Version 6.3.3 for Google Play. Fixed an animation bug that surfaced with a change in the default handling of the AnimationDrawable.oneShot property in Android 5.1.

Calling coinAnimation.stop() from the animation finish callback can potentially cause the spinning annimation to stop mid-frame on slower devices.  However, stop() needs to be called before calling start() again, so just call stop() before the next start().
Made the Coin object a legitimate singleton.  Changed mobile layout to FrameLayout with a width/height of match_parent.
Updated SDK and build tools versions.
New material design icons!
New query for 'Get More Coins' link in Settings which hopefully will only show SCF expansion packs.
